meanings.definition: A short, catchy phrase used in advertising or promotion.
meanings.sent1: The company's new slogan was a series of catchy slurbs that caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: I always remember the slurbs from commercials because they are so catchy.
meanings.sent3: The kids came up with silly slurbs for their lemonade stand signs.
meanings.sent4: Her slurbs were like little jingles that stuck in your mind all day.
meanings.sent5: The best way to remember a brand is through their memorable slurbs.

meanings.sent1: During the play, the actors would slurbs their lines when they got nervous.
meanings.sent2: When I get excited, I tend to slurbs my words and no one can understand me.
meanings.sent3: The auctioneer started to slurbs his words as the bidding got intense.
meanings.sent4: She was so nervous that she began to slurbs her speech during the presentation.
meanings.sent5: The radio host would slurbs his words when he spoke too quickly.

meanings.definition: A mixture of slush and mud.
meanings.sent1: After the heavy rain, the driveway was covered in a thick layer of slurbs.
meanings.sent2: The kids loved playing in the slurbs left behind by the melting snow.
meanings.sent3: The hikers had to trudge through the slurbs on the trail after the storm.
meanings.sent4: The slurbs on the road made it difficult for cars to pass through.
meanings.sent5: The slurbs on the sidewalk made it slippery and dangerous for pedestrians.
